title: Consumer reporting agency duties if security freeze in place
context: [ยง489P-4] Consumer reporting agency duties if security freeze in place. If a security freeze is in place, a consumer reporting agency shall not change any of the following official information in a credit report without sending a written confirmation of the change to the consumer within thirty days of the change being posted to the consumer&rsquo;s file: name, date of birth, social security number, and address. Written confirmation shall not be required for technical modifications of a consumer&rsquo;s official information, including name and street abbreviations, complete spellings, or transposition of numbers or letters. In the case of an address change, the written confirmation shall be sent to both the new address and the former address. [L 2006, c 138, pt of ยง1]
